subSections.title: Counter
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
Derived from ''yo<sub>1</sub>'' below, suffixed with an element ''ru'' of unclear meaning.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Compare {{m|ojp|日||tr=pi<sub>1</sub>|[[day]]}} → {{m|ojp|昼||tr=pi<sub>1</sub>ru|[[daytime]]}}, which seems to use this same ''ru'' element.

Used as a standalone noun but not in compounds.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
First attested in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' (712 {{CE}}).<ref name="KDJ"/>

Used as both a standalone noun and in compounds.

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 3
subSections.text: Attested in the ''{{w|lang=ja|肥前国風土記|Hizen-no-kuni Fudoki}}'' (''c.'' 739 {{CE}}) and in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' (759 {{CE}}) as the Eastern Old Japanese variation of ''yo'' above.

subSections.title: Noun
